free: #e I’m here at your place, my dear aunt.
#c 我在阿姨你這邊。
#n 一般稱女性長輩為 baybudan 但為表示親暱亦可稱 tina (mother), 同理, 稱男性長輩為 baqi 表示親暱則稱 tama (father). 故此處英譯為 dear aunt 。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e Yeah.
#c 嗯。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e I came to your place.
#c 我來到你家。

free: #e He (an NTU student) said, ‘I want to hear something about the earthquake in the past.’
#c 他(某位台大學生)說「我想要聽聽有關從前地震的事」。

free: #e I said to you, ‘How was the earthquake here in PakteRung?’
#c 我跟你說，「新社這裡的地震情形是如何」。

free: #e I think that since you’re older than me, anyhow you’d know something about the earthquake.
#c 我想你不管如何年紀都比我長，應該知道有關地震的事。
#n qa-qaqa aiku timaisuan: I am older than you. 我年紀比你大
#n sa-swani aiku timaisuan: I am younger than you. 我年紀比你小

#c 那樣也許沒錯，但是我並不知道什麼有關地震的事情，好像...

#c 我也不知道往哪裡想，我想我很笨。

free: #e So (the one who can tell us the story) should be you, who are both knowledgeable and smart.
#c 所以應該由比較知道而且也比較聰明的你(來說地震的故事)。
#n qawanay aisu s<m>inap=ay, mana aizipna: 應該是你在掃地，怎麼變成是他。

#c 你記得他說的，那個地震的(事情)。

#c 你來說吧。

#c 那樣啊，不過我還是覺得你應該是知道我們以前地震的事。

free: #e Well, (that happened when) we still lived in TebaRung.
#c 嗯, (那是發生在)我們還住在TebaRung的時候。

free: #e When we were having breakfast, the earthquake happened.
#c 我們那時候正在吃早餐，然後地震就來了。

free: #e The earthquake happened. It’s a pity that all the bowls fell off due to the earthquake.
#c 地震就來啦，然後地震就把所有的碗都震倒了，真是可惜阿。
#n bibiaq-an-ku sabaq: 我把稻穀弄得散落一地
#n t<m>ibuq 某物體落下 ; bibiaq 成群物體落下

#c 從前的地震就是那樣。

free: #e (It’s) dangerous.
#c 很危險。
#n qaytis-an (<afraid-AN) <害怕-AN
#n mawRat tu Ramaz qaitisan 玩火很危險
#n qaytisan siqay 蛇很危險

#c 洞穴那邊的懸崖很多都塌了。

#c 那時你結婚了沒?

#c (民國)三十九年 ... 我想我結婚了，還是還沒呢?

#c 結了嗎？

#c 結婚了，但是還沒生小孩。

free: #e We were still at Tebalon when the strong earthquake happened.
#c 大地震那時，我們還在tebalon那裡。

free: #e I was still very little when I knew the strong earthquake happened.
#c 我知道以前那個大地震時，我還很小。
#n *pama=iku kiya
#n *kiya=iku pama
#n m-utuz tu Raya=ay utuz. ‘The quake shakes strongly.’ 地震很強
#n m-uzan tu Raya=ay uzan. ‘It rains heavily.’ 雨下很大
#n m-uzan tu Raya ‘It rains heavily.’ 雨下很大。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e I was only ten years old then.
#c 我那時年紀才十歲。
#n Rabtin=ti tasaw aiku tazian 我在這裡已經十年了。‘I’ve been here for ten years.’

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e It was 1950.
#c 那時是(民國)三十九年。

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e Like what you said, the earthquake (happened) in the early morning.
#c 正如你說的那樣，地震是(發生)在早上。
#n taRbabi 早上 morning; smuRap 清晨 early morning
#n azu sanu-su = azu ni-sanu-an-su

meta.language: 噶瑪蘭語, Kavalan, Xinshe (新社)
meta.speaker: 潘天利, Abas, male, 1933-03-22

free: #e It was in the early morning. We were still eating breakfast.
#c 是早上沒錯，(因為)我們(那時候)還在吃早餐。
#n (mai)=pama=ita q<m>an sa-taRbabi 我們還沒吃早餐。 ‘We haven’t had breakfast yet.’
#n yau=pama=ita q<m>an sa-taRbabi 我們還在吃早餐。 ‘We’re still having breakfast.’
#n pun=ti=iku q<m>an sa-taRbabi 我已經吃過早餐。 ‘I finished having breakfast.’
#n pun=ti sa-taRbabi-an 早餐準備好了。 ‘Breakfast is ready.’
#n pun=ti=iku s<m>angi tu sa-taRbabi-an 我已經準備好早餐了。 ‘I finished making breakfast.’
#n sa-taRbabi-an-ku zau. 我早餐要吃這些。 ‘This is what I am going to eat for breakfast.’

free: #e My grandpa went to the sea to net and catch fish.
#c 我阿公去海邊放網捕魚
#n putiamling = pa-tiamling = pa-salil 放網 to toss the net; *pu-salil
#n zau sa-pa-salil-an-ku 這是我要放網的(e.g.漁網) This is the fish net that I’ll toss.
#n zau sa-salil-an-ku 這是我樣放網的(e.g.地方) This is the place where I toss the net.
#n zau sa-sangi-an-ku tu salil 這是我要做漁網的(e.g.網線之類的東西) This is the material that I am making the fish net with.

#c 那是夏天還是什麼時候？我怎麼不記得了？
